item.title: sqlite can be used document and graph database
item.description: I found that the use-cases for sqlite keep increasing now the JSON is supported. This week I found the following presentation: https://www.hytradboi.com/2022/simple-graph-sqlite-as-probably-the-only-graph-database-youll-ever-need Which makes the case for a simple graph schema, and using SQL out-of-the-box functionality to store graphs and execute traversal queries. This repository is actually based on this one focused on JSON support and document databases: https://dgl.cx/2020/06/sqlite-json-support

item.title: Explore Kafka data with kcat, sqlite, and Datasette
item.description: I have been playing with Datasette and sqlite for a bit, trying to collect and expose data efficiently for others to analyze. Recently started finding use-cases to get data from Apache Kafka, and expose it quickly to analyze it. Why not using Datasette?
